Name: A_Desktop
Description: The full path and name of the current user's desktop folder. For example: C:\Users\YourName\Desktop

Name: A_DesktopCommon
Description: The full path and name of the all-users desktop folder. For example: C:\Users\Public\Desktop

Name: A_IsAdmin
Description: Contains 1 if the current user has admin rights, otherwise 0.

Name: A_AppData
Description: The full path and name of the folder containing the current user's application-specific data.

Name: A_AppDataCommon
Description: The full path and name of the folder containing the all-users application-specific data.

Name: A_ComputerName
Description: The name of the computer as seen on the network.

Name: A_UserName
Description: The logon name of the user who launched this script.

Name: A_WinDir
Description: The Windows directory. For example: C:\Windows

Name: A_ProgramFiles
Description: The Program Files directory (e.g. C:\Program Files or C:\Program Files (x86)). This is usually the same as the ProgramFiles environment variable.

Name: A_Temp
Description: The full path and name of the folder designated to hold temporary files.

Name: A_WorkingDir
Description: Can be used to get or set the script's current working directory, which is where files will be accessed by default.

Name: InputHook
Description: A class for creating hooks that capture keyboard input.

Description: Begins a new input hook (to capture input events).

Name: Start()
Description: Starts the input hook.

Name: Stop()
Description: Stops the input hook.

Name: KeyOpt(VK
Description: InputHook
Parameters: Sets options for a specific key in the input hook (such as blocking or not).

Name: Opt(Option
Description: InputHook
Parameters: Sets a general option for the input hook.

Name: Wait(Timeout)
Description: Waits for input (keys) until a timeout or the input is complete.

Name: EndKey
Description: Gets the name of the key that ended the input hook.

Name: EndKeyVK
Description: Gets the virtual key code of the key that ended the input hook.

Name: EndKeySC
Description: Gets the scan code of the key that ended the input hook.

Name: EndHook
Description: Indicates whether the input hook ended (true/false).

Name: EndReason
Description: Indicates the reason the input hook ended (e.g., "Max" if the max input length was reached).

Name: EndApp
Description: Gets the name of the application window that was active when the input hook ended.

Name: EndWindow
Description: Gets the title of the window that was active when the input hook ended.

Name: EndControl
Description: Gets the name of the control that was active when the input hook ended.

Name: EndType
Description: Indicates how the input ended ("Timeout", "Cancel", etc.).

Name: EndTime
Description: Indicates the time (in milliseconds) when the input ended.

Name: MaxHistory
Description: Gets or sets the maximum length of the input history.

Name: MaxLength
Description: Gets or sets the maximum length of the input.

Name: SetTimeout(Timeout)
Description: Sets a timeout for the input (after which it will end automatically).

Name: Input
Description: The text that was captured by the input hook.

Name: EndReason(Value)
Description: Ends the input hook with a given reason (if possible).

Name: Reset()
Description: Resets the input hook to initial state.

Description: InputHook
Parameters: Sets a callback function to be called when a key is pressed during the input.

Name: OnKeyUp(KeyName
Description: InputHook
Parameters: Sets a callback function to be called when a key is released during the input.

Name: OnChar(Func)
Description: Sets a callback function to be called when a character is input.

Name: OnEnd(Func)
Description: Sets a callback function to be called when the input hook ends.

Name: End(KeyName)
Description: Ends the input hook as if the given key were pressed.

Name: EndVk
Description: Gets the virtual key code of the key that ended the input hook.

Name: EndSC
Description: Gets the scan code of the key that ended the input hook.

Name: #ClipboardTimeout
Description: Changes how long the script keeps trying to access the clipboard when the first attempt fails.

Name: #DllLoad
Description: Loads a DLL or EXE file before the script starts executing.

Name: #Hotstring

Name: #Hotstring
Description: Changes hotstring options or ending characters.

Name: #HotIf
Description: Creates context-sensitive hotkeys and hotstrings. Such hotkeys perform a different action (or none at all) depending on any condition (an expression).

Name: #HotIfTimeout
Description: Sets the maximum time that may be spent evaluating a single #HotIf expression.

Name: #Include
Description: Causes the script to behave as though the specified file's contents are present at this exact position.

Name: #Include
Description: Causes the script to behave as though the specified file's contents are present at this exact position.

Name: #IncludeAgain
Description: Causes the script to behave as though the specified file's contents are present at this exact position.

Name: #InputLevel
Description: Controls which artificial keyboard and mouse events are ignored by hotkeys and hotstrings.

Name: #MaxThreads
Description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous threads.

Name: #MaxThreadsBuffer
Description: Causes some or all hotkeys to buffer rather than ignore keypresses when their #MaxThreadsPerHotkey limit has been reached.

Name: #MaxThreadsPerHotkey
Description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneous threads per hotkey or hotstring.

Name: #NoTrayIcon
Description: Disables the showing of a tray icon.

Name: #Requires
Description: Displays an error and quits if a version requirement is not met.

Name: #SingleInstance
Description: Determines whether a script is allowed to run again when it is already running.

Name: #SuspendExempt
Description: Exempts subsequent hotkeys and hotstrings from suspension.

Name: #UseHook
Description: Forces the use of the hook to implement all or some hotkeys.

Name: If
Parameters: (Expression); Var [Not] Between LowerBound and UpperBound; Var [Not] in Value1,Value2,...; Var [Not] Contains Value1,Value2,...; Var is [Not] Type

Name: (Expression)
Description: Force an expression. `(Expression)` can be used to override default precedence or to clarify evaluation order.
Logical-not operator. Flips the truth value of its operand (true to false
Multiplication operator. Multiplies two values.
Addition operator. Adds two values.
Increment operator. Increases a numeric variable's value by 1.
Add-assign operator. Adds a value to a variable and assigns the result back to the variable.
Subtraction operator. Subtracts one value from another.
Decrement operator. Decreases a numeric variable's value by 1.
Subtract-assign operator. Subtracts a value from a variable and assigns the result back.
Multiplication operator. Multiplies a value to a variable and assigns the result back (same as `var := var * value`).
Multiply-assign operator. Multiplies a value with a variable and assigns back.
Division operator. Divides one value by another.
Divide-assign operator. Divides a variable by a value and assigns the result back.
Floor divide-assign operator. Performs integer division and assigns back.
Modulus (remainder) operator. Yields the remainder of dividing one number by another.
Modulus-assign operator. Computes the remainder and assigns it back.
Exponentiation operator. Raises a number to the power of another.
Exponentiation-assign operator. Raises a number to a power and assigns back.
Assignment operator. Assigns a value to a variable.
Case-sensitive equality operator. Returns true if two values are equal (with case sensitivity for strings).
Case-sensitive and type-sensitive equality operator. Returns true if two values are equal and of the same type.
Case-sensitive inequality operator. Returns true if two values are not equal (with case sensitivity for strings).
Case-sensitive and type-sensitive inequality operator. Returns true if two values are not equal or not of the same type.
Less-than operator. True if left value is less than right value.
Less-than-or-equal operator. True if left value is less than or equal to right value.
Greater-than operator. True if left value is greater than right value.
Greater-than-or-equal operator. True if left value is greater than or equal to right value.
Logical AND operator. True if both operands are true (non-zero/non-blank).
Logical OR operator. True if at least one operand is true (non-zero/non-blank).
Concatenation operator. Concatenates (joins) two values (usually strings).
Ternary conditional operator. Syntax: `condition ? value_if_true : value_if_false`.
Dollar sign operator (legacy). Marks the end of a variable name in a legacy %var% expression.
Legacy variable dereference operator. Used in expressions like `%Var%` to retrieve a variable's value (AHK v1 style).
Escape character (backtick). Used to escape special characters in strings (e.g.

Name:
,Operator,,Double-quote mark. Used to denote string literals.,,
Operators,`,,Operator,,Comma (multi-statement). Commas may be used to write multiple commands on one line.,,
Operators,;,Operator,,Semicolon (comment). Denotes a comment when placed at the start of a line or after a command.,,
Operators,::,Operator,,Hotkey/hotstring definition operator. Used to define hotkeys/hotstrings (prefix in script lines).,,
Operators,//,Operator,,Floor division operator. Divides one number by another and truncates toward negative infinity.,,
Operators,%%,Operator,,Force expression operator (legacy). `%%` around an expression forced expression evaluation in legacy syntax.,,
Operators,&,Operator,,Bitwise AND operator. Performs a bitwise AND on two numbers.,,
Operators,|,Operator,,Bitwise OR operator. Performs a bitwise OR on two numbers.,,
Operators,^,Operator,,Bitwise XOR operator. Performs a bitwise exclusive OR on two numbers.,,
Operators,~,Operator,,Bitwise NOT operator. Flips all bits in a number (bitwise inversion).,,
Operators,<<,Operator,,Bitwise left-shift operator. Shifts the bits of the left operand to the left by the number of positions specified by the right operand.,,
Operators,>>,Operator,,Bitwise right-shift operator. Shifts the bits of the left operand to the right by the number of positions specified by the right operand (sign-extended).,,
Operators,>>>,Operator,,Logical (zero-fill) right-shift operator. Shifts bits to the right, filling with zeros.,,
Operators,.,Operator,,Member access (dot operator). Used to access object properties/methods.,,
Operators,[],Operator,,Array access (brackets). Used to access array elements or object properties by key.,,
Operators,{},Operator,,Block delimiter (curly braces). Used to define blocks of code (e.g., in functions or flow control statements).,,
Operators,/* */,Operator,,Block comment delimiters. `/*` begins a block comment and `*/` ends it.,,
Operators,`,,Operator,,Line continuation operator (accent). Used at line end to continue code on next line.,,
Operators,=>,Operator,,Function definition operator (fat arrow). Used in defining functions (expression-style).,,
Operators,->,Operator,,Object bind operator. Used to bind a function to an object as `obj->Method()`.,,
Operators,[],Operator,,Function call operator (square brackets for arrays/objects). In v2, function call uses parentheses, `[]` is array indexing.,,
Operators,??,Operator,,Null-coalescing operator. Returns the left operand if it is not null/blank, otherwise returns the right operand.,,
Operators,?=,Operator,,Null-coalescing assignment. Assigns a value only if the variable is null/blank.,,
Operators,?..,Operator,,Safe navigation operator (null conditional). Allows property/method access only if object is not null.,,
Operators,::=,Operator,,Function definition operator (double colon equals). Used in defining functions in certain contexts (rare).,,
Operators,@,Operator,,Address-of operator. Returns the memory address of a variable.,,
Operators,$,Operator,,Reference assignment operator (AHK v2 uses `alias` instead).,,
Operators,[],Operator,,Square brackets usage in expressions (context-dependent).,,
